body: Well obviously God had to show up well before 30 AD all over the world, how else do you think Abraham and Moses etc. knew?

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

body: We did have organized religion. And it's been a farce every single time. The church and later the bible canon were created to suppress early Christianity and control the masses as usual. Before that we had a centralized hybrid of Babylonian-Israelite-Judahite faith which became Judaism. Before that it was the Levitical priesthood and Israelite and Judahite paganism, which was so prevelant that historians quite understandly mistake it for preceding monotheism. After the church we got Islam, then thousands of protestant denominations who complain about the scandals of the catholic church and then pull the same exact crap themselves. Who knows what they did in 30,000 BC, or any other time, or in other parts of the world, but I'm willing to bet it was the same old "make a phony cult to get people in line and tell them to always worship the tribe and serve the elites, and don't let them find out about the real God, only what we tell them". That's always the response to get people in line again after an awakening. Humans are so fucking predictable.
body_html: We did have organized religion. And it's been a farce every single time. The church and later the bible canon were created to suppress early Christianity and control the masses as usual. Before that we had a centralized hybrid of Babylonian-Israelite-Judahite faith which became Judaism. Before that it was the Levitical priesthood and Israelite and Judahite paganism, which was so prevelant that historians quite understandly mistake it for preceding monotheism. After the church we got Islam, then thousands of protestant denominations who complain about the scandals of the catholic church and then pull the same exact crap themselves. Who knows what they did in 30,000 BC, or any other time, or in other parts of the world, but I'm willing to bet it was the same old "make a phony cult to get people in line and tell them to always worship the tribe and serve the elites, and don't let them find out about the real God, only what we tell them". That's always the response to get people in line again after an awakening. Humans are so fucking predictable.

author.bio:
Jesus said, "Behold, I am coming soon."

Repent! For the Kingdom of Heaven is at hand!
author.bio_html:
Jesus said, "Behold, I am coming soon."

Repent! For the Kingdom of Heaven is at hand!

body:
My history degree attempts to kamikaze off the wall into a fireplace whenever someone unironicallly tries to use Wikipedia as a source. 

In all seriousness though, if we are deciding which religion is oldest by age, wouldn't the ancient Hebrew religion (which is a part of Christianity if we are being honest) be the oldest still surviving religion? Egyptians don't worship Ra anymore. They are all Christians or Muslims. England is a Christian country that uses Stonehenge as a tourist location. 

All that said, "oldest" does not always mean "better". If that was the case, we would all be abandoning toilets for holes in the ground.
body_html:
My history degree attempts to kamikaze off the wall into a fireplace whenever someone unironicallly tries to use Wikipedia as a source.

In all seriousness though, if we are deciding which religion is oldest by age, wouldn't the ancient Hebrew religion (which is a part of Christianity if we are being honest) be the oldest still surviving religion? Egyptians don't worship Ra anymore. They are all Christians or Muslims. England is a Christian country that uses Stonehenge as a tourist location.

All that said, "oldest" does not always mean "better". If that was the case, we would all be abandoning toilets for holes in the ground.
